summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 2020 between FBI personnel and an attorney regarding the processing of victim compensation applications related to the Jeffrey Epstein case. It discusses administrative follow-up for two victims, confirming their victim status and providing FBI case details.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Attorney who communicated with FBI regarding a victim's compensation application, providing the application and clarifying information requests.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the perpetrator whose crimes the victim compensation applications are related to; FBI case number references his investigation.

persons.name: Cassidy
persons.context: Mentioned as possibly being assigned to a victim's claim application, but the email sender is unsure due to being out of the office.

connections.description: Henderson, as a trial attorney, is involved in submitting a compensation application for a victim of Epstein's crimes.

events.title: Period of crimes against two victims
events.description: The date of crime for two victims confirmed by the FBI case agent, occurring between 2003 and 2004.

events.title: Period of crime for another victim
events.description: Date of crime provided for a separate victim application, spanning from 2001 to 2004.

keyFacts: The FBI case number for the Jeffrey Epstein investigation is 31E-NY-3027571.
Two victims were confirmed by an FBI case agent, with crimes occurring between 2003 and 2004.
Administrative processing for victim compensation claims was ongoing in 2020, involving follow-up on missing information like crime dates and FBI case numbers.
The county of occurrence for Epstein-related crimes is identified as Manhattan.
Communication indicates the challenges of remote work during the COVID-19 pandemic affecting case processing.
